briefdescription.para: Use basic optimizations (e.g. removing sorting, removing duplicate elimination, or constant folding).
Use basic optimizations (like O1) and some more optimizations (like not to generate an iterator for inlined functions) - call stacks in case of an exception are not generated.
The optimization level used for optimizing the query.
Set of hints that can be passed to the query compiler.

detaileddescription.para: An instance of this class can be passed to the compileQuery function of the Zorba class or the compile function of this class. The members of this class represent hints that are passed to the query compiler. For example, whether optimization of the query should be done (O1) or not (O0).
example_6 in file simple.cpp shows an example how CompilerHints can be used.

briefdescription.para: Wraps a char* to make it a compile-time error to assign to the pointer directly.
Options that configure the serialization process of a query result.

detaileddescription.para: This struct defines options that can be passed to the serialization process of a query result. An instance of this class can be passed to the serialize function.
File serialization.cpp contains examples that show how to use the SerializerOptions.

briefdescription.para: Helper function for C to set default values ComplilerHints struct.
Frees all internal data used by a Zorba_SerializerOptions.

detaileddescription.para: This is needed only in C code; C++ code calls the destructor. Note that this does not free opts itself (which may be on the stack).
This is needed only in C code; C++ code calls the default constructor.

briefdescription.para: Sets an option in a Zorba_SerializerOptions.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the option to be set.

simplesect.para: true only if all the arguments were valid; false otherwise.

Set of hints that can be passed to the query compiler.
Wraps a char* to make it a compile-time error to assign to the pointer directly.
